tool_description: High performance API for web scraping. Emulates Chrome TLS fingerprint, backed by rotating proxies (geos: US, EU, Brazil, France, Germany, 4g residential proxies available!) and smart retries. Use this when node.js/curl/python fails to load the website even with headers fully identical to Chrome, but you still need fast scraping and want to avoid using Puppeteer and JS evaluation (ScrapeNinja returns raw HTTP responses by default). Javascript rendering is available, as well! Read more: https:...
title: ScrapeNinja

api_list.name: /scrape-js
api_list.description: Launches real Chrome browser engine, use only when /scrape endpoint features are not enough.  Leverage `catchAjaxHeadersUrlMask` to catch some cookies which are generated by the website protections and then use them in /scrape calls
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://scrapeninja.p.rapidapi.com/scrape-js"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "scrapeninja.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: /scrape (legacy)
api_list.description: Scrape via GET method. Not recommended for production, you'd better use POST requests.

api_list.name: /scrape-js
api_list.description: Launches real Chrome browser engine, use only when /scrape endpoint features are not enough.  Leverage `catchAjaxHeadersUrlMask` to catch some cookies which are generated by the website protections and then use them in /scrape calls
